bugs.title: CVE-2015-8789 libebml: Usa-after-free vulnerability in EblMaster::Read() [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-8789 libebml: Usa-after-free vulnerability in EblMaster::Read() [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-8789 libebml: Use-after-free vulnerability in EblMaster::Read()

long_desc.thetext:
When the parser encountered a deeply nested element with an infinite size then a following element of an upper level was not propagated correctly. Instead the element with the infinite size was added into the EBML element tree a second time resulting in memory access after freeing it and multiple attempts to free the same memory address during destruction.

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/Matroska-Org/libebml/commit/88409e2a94dd3b40ff81d08bf6d92f486d036b24

Created libebml tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1276336]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1276337]
Added CVE according to http://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2015-8789/
*** Bug 1412632 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Rathann, I'm re-assigning this one to you, since as a general rule I do not maintain EPEL packages (I simply do not have the time for them). This CVE is fixed by upgrading libebml to 1.3.3, which likely is just a matter of syncing with Fedora.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-8791 CVE-2015-8790 libebml: information leaks in two functions [epel-6]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-8791 CVE-2015-8790 libebml: information leaks in two functions [epel-6]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-8791 libebml: function EbmlElement::ReadCodedSizeValue leaks information

long_desc.thetext:
The EbmlElement::ReadCodedSizeValue function in libEBML before 1.3.3 allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from process heap memory via a crafted length value in an EBML id, which triggers an invalid memory access.

External references:

http://www.scip.ch/en/?vuldb.80729
https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2015-8791

Upstream fix:

https://github.com/Matroska-Org/libebml/commit/24e5cd7c666b1ddd85619d60486db0a5481c1b90

Created libebml tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1303854]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1303856]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-8790 libebml: the EbmlUnicodeString::UpdateFromUTF8 function leaks information

long_desc.thetext:
The EbmlUnicodeString::UpdateFromUTF8 function in libEBML before 1.3.3 allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from process heap memory via a crafted UTF-8 string, which triggers an invalid memory access.

External references:

http://www.scip.ch/en/?vuldb.80728
https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2015-8790

Upstream fix:

https://github.com/Matroska-Org/libebml/commit/ababb64e0c792ad2a314245233db0833ba12036b
*** Bug 1412629 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Rathann, I'm re-assigning this one to you, since as a general rule I do not maintain EPEL packages (I simply do not have the time for them). This CVE is fixed by upgrading libebml to 1.3.3, which likely is just a matter of syncing with Fedora.
Unfortunately the 1.3.x series has an ABI change (SOname bump), so it's not so trivial to simply update. I'll take a look at backporting the code changes, but I don't have too much time for this.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by rathann.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has reached 14 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by rathann.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
New in 1.2.2 version:

* fix usage of the DEBUG #define (use LIBEBML_DEBUG instead)
* The EbmlCodeVersion variable now resides in the library instead of being declared static in the header file.
* only use the test element to read once in the loop

Backported fixes for:

* CVE-2015-8789 libebml: Usa-after-free vulnerability in EblMaster::Read()
* CVE-2015-8790 CVE-2015-8791 libebml: information leaks in two functions
title: libebml-1.2.2-1.el6
